posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
As usual lately I haven't had much time to look thoroughly at builds, but I see some flaws in this one that IMO could and should be corrected:

1- The spread is far from optimized. Going RDD heavy is the worst possible choice in this class combo, you either go Bard heavy or Fighter heavy depending on what you want to achieve. If you decide to go Fighter-heavy, I suggest the F 28 B 2 RDD 10 spread. That one has enough feats to fulfill your wildest dreams, but is low on skill points and spell-wise it's null. If you choose to go Bard-heavy, then B 26 F 4 RDD 10 is best, but you won't have enough feats to get DWing without giving up something important. However, you can go Bard 9 F 3 RDD 8 pre-epic for 25 BAB and you take the 4th fighter level on a general feat level in epics for WS/EWS. You'd need more Charisma to cast all spells, and your Bard Song would be tremendously effective. You could get Lasting Inspiration instead of Lingering Song and you'd have many interesting skill alternatives at your disposal.

2- You're taking 2 Song feats for 8 levels of Bard. Either you go for it like I mentioned above, or you don't, but wasting 2 feats on a lvl 8 Bard song is IMO very very bad.

3- You have no Weapon Focus, why? doesn't +3 AB appeal to ya?

4- Why waste skill points in Lore, Bluff and Persuade? I have played Aielund and still cannot find a good reason to do so..

There might be more stuff too, but this was the stuff I spotted. Guys, the lack of DevCrit is because it's banned in Aielund IIRC, right empyre?

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Bard is there to give me access to RDD, and additional levels are there for skill dumps. I might take advantage of some buffing spells and the Bard song, but they're gravy, not the focus of the build. The two RDD bonus feats are all I need, since I'm not specializing on any single weapon. I wouldn't know what to do with all those Fighter feats, so I took more RDD levels for the 2 AC points and for the D12 hit die.

If I had Weapon Focus (let alone Dev Crit) on a weapon, I'd feel obligated to only use that weapon, and I wanted to be free to use any weapon I found that was better than what I was already using.

Lore is there because I hate paying 100 gold to identify stuff, penny pincher that I am. Bluff and Intimidate are there to help me talk Dante out of fighting me in Chapter 4. I always really hate having to kill him. Besides, I maxed out all the skills I needed to and had some points left over.
